article_title: How Obamacare's Employer Mandate Harms Low-Wage Workers

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: Years after the Great Recession officially ended, workforce participation, unemployment and the number of workers involuntarily working part-time have remained stubbornly high. In contrast to what is typical—that the deeper the recession, the more robust the rebound—the United States is in a "jobless recovery" with tepid growth in Gross Domestic Product after a particularly severe recession. This begs the question of "why?"
